posts.body:
the developer just added a WTFPL license, most likely in response to your post.
Having it unlicensed was just an individualist rejection of property rights in the true J.S. Mill fashion.
t. not the developer but someone who greatly admires millchan
Do we have a timestamp for when the manifesto was posted? If it's proven the shooter didn't post the manifesto 8chan could appeal to cloudflare and come back to the clearnet.
there literally is. ZeroVoat is a thing.

posts.subject: Dark Web Prevention Act
posts.body:
House Democrats and some Republicucks are drafting some legislation which you guys might find relevant.
>will ban "dark network" software, i.e. Tor, I2P, ZeroNet.
>writing "dark network" software will be treated as providing an illegal service even if you never ran a node
>"digital currencies" will require government approval on a case by case basis. Coins that provide anonymization will be banned. Monero specifically named.
>VPNs users will require a license and there will a gov. database
Likely will be written out:
>civillian use of E2E encryption will be banned
>full disk encryption will be banned

>>1d577fc2-93e8-4e24-8110-5808a30ee413
That's only a working name. It's not what the bill will actually be called when its introduced.
There are special focus groups for these things that come up with names the public will symphasize with, usually ones that form a nice sounding acronym (like the SAFE act).
>>a47c8c2c-1875-4b23-ac2e-22ea2566118c
Just like the Patriot got challenged on 4A grounds, right?

The solution probably isn't decentralized CAPTCHAs. The solution is giant invite tree mutes and optional blocklists.

Users cannot openly join. Users must instead be invited by other users. Muting a user mutes all other users invited by them just like a tree ban. This makes things sybil resistant.

There are a limited number of invites. Newly invited users cannot invite other users.

New invites are given out occasionally.
